campaign.story:
Moisture-Wicking Patch Absorbs On The Inside Without Showing Through The Outside (Coffee Used As Example)
Hydrophobic Solution Reflects All Water, Oil, and Protein-Based Liquids
Our Story
The idea for a sweat-proof dress shirt first came to David during a transitional point in his life, after his move from New York to Florida. Without being previously accustomed to the heat and humidity of the South, his profuse sweating became a pressing issue that he couldn't seem to resolve. After countless months of trial and error from appointments with dermatologists, to spending hundreds of dollars on expensive shirts, the stains became inevitable. He seemed to sweat through every dress shirt he wore - whether it was walking into work or just simply a nice evening out with some friends. The more frustrated David grew with this problem, the more he realized he wasn't alone.
We’ve all experienced it—whether it be the result of climate, anxiety or simply running late—we’ve all perspired through a shirt. It’s a common embarrassment, and one that need not count against us, when appearances matter most.
With this idea in hand, David approached his lifetime friend, Jacob Boyer, where the two worked while attending school at the University of Central Florida self-funding this vision and seeking the answer to the sweat issue. 
And thus DAVID HYDE APPAREL was created- A clothing line that not only protects it's users from this issue but also does so in a fashionable way. 
The Product 
David Hyde Apparel's performance is the result of two factorial components in each of our products. On the outside of our clothing, we treat a light-weight, luxurious cotton blend with an Eco-friendly Hydrophobic Solution that repels of ALL water, oil, and protein based liquids. This solution is conducted with "Green-Chemistry" here in the United States and is not only organic, but PFC & PFOA-Free, passing all issued third-party toxicology testing. We also use a silver alternative in our solution for bacterial breakdown allowing our products to be odor-free. This alternative is not only healthier to the touch, but also clean to the environment.
The inside consists of our patent-pending patch design that draws moisture from the body to dry at a 2.5x faster rate than normal cotton. These patches consist of a moisture-wicking fabric that is both breathable as well as elastic for a proficient range of motion. They are then placed along the inner-lining of each of our shirts where you are prone to sweat the most. The usage of double sided fabric not only allows for the outer layer's appearance to remain unaltered, but also allows for the relief of moisture in comparison to similar, reflective products where the moisture sits unpleasantly on the skin throughout the day eventually showing through. 
Because of our patch design, many ask if weight becomes a factor to our products- and the answer is NO. Through trial and error with over 10 prototypes and 1,000+ fabrics tested, we have successfully found a blend that can both uphold our performance standards as well as deliver a competitive, light-weight feel when worn. Our fabric suppliers are extremely educated on industry trends and strive to remain current with new technology allowing us to quickly adapt/upgrade our products with ease, if necessary.  
Manufacturing
All of our products will be made in the Los Angeles' Fashion District at our partner facility. Our manufacturer team has members that have been in the fashion industry for 30+ years who have worked diligently with us on the design ensuring prestigious quality alongside a modern look. They have worked with several reputable brands earning them global exposure and a significant identity in the fashion business. 
Previous Manufacturer Clients/ Partners
BackerClub is an exclusive club for people who love Kickstarter and back a ton of projects. BackerClub is featuring our campaign in the Club this week. We're excited about what they are doing and hope you like it too!  
Proud user of http://kickingitforward.org
Sizing & Color
Sizing chart to be released soon via email to all of our backers following our campaign. Here we will coordinate color preference and sizing for each of the products promised in our reward program. We plan to cover sizes S (Limited), M, L, XL, XXL and XXXL (Limited) for our initial launch.  
For our first production, we will be offering three colors- Cadet Blue (light Blue), White as well as Mauve (Lavender). Additional colors and patterns will be available when we launch our site following this campaign. 
Timeline
FAQ
How do I choose a color and size for my shirt?
-Once the Kickstarter is complete, we will contact all donors for color and size selection.
What colors will be offered?
-Aqua Blue, Lavender, White
Are the shirts machine washable?
-We recommend laundering, but the shirts are machine washable. We recommend ironing on low-medium heat, and to NOT use dryer sheets when drying.
Does the shirt repel sauces like ketchup and mustard?
-Our shirt repel all water, oil, and protein based liquids. The shirt will be stained by sauces, but will wash away due to our "Stain Release" treatment.
Refunds/ Exchanges
Due to this being a "fundraiser" for production and development of our company, there will be no refunds issued for any of our pre-order purchased products. However, we will be more than happy to exchange any products received for different sizes or colors to ensure satisfaction with funding our project. For future business we plan for a refund and exchange policy to be implemented to provide consumers with comfortability when shopping David Hyde Apparel.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Production: Because of the unique design behind each of our products, the first cycle of production may be longer than future orders as our materials are sourced from several cities within the United States. The size of the first production run is estimated to yield 1,000 dress shirts which will take a month alone in shipment of raw materials as well as treatment of the fabric. Once everything has arrived at our production facility in Los Angeles, assembly of the shirts at the 1,000 ct. could take as long as two months. For transparency purposes, you will receive emails during the whole production process. 

Product Performance: We have thoroughly tested each one of our shirts and deemed them capable of all of the performance factors we market them with. That being said, not only is there always room for improvement but always room for error as well. There may be certain stain scenarios that our shirts fail to overcome or you may sweat in areas that aren't included in our patch design- We get it. Part of our raised capital from our Kickstarter will be solely invested in further R&D for our sweat-proof technology. This is more than a product, its a solution.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Hyde Supporters,
Happy Monday!
We are extremely happy to announce that 75% of the orders have been shipped. If you haven't received your order yet, please keep a look out this week for the delivery. A few of the shirt sizes were on backorder due to high demand, but will have them to you as soon as possible.

Hey Hyde Supporters,
Great news!
The shirts are currently in route to Hyde HQ, and will arrive here this Thursday, February 21st. Our plan is to pack through the weekend, and have our first scheduled pick-up from UPS on Tuesday, February 25th. This will give us enough time to get a little more than half of the orders out (About 150 pre-orders) with another pick-up following a few days after. The second pick-up will be next Friday, March 1st, where we hope to have all domestic pre-orders shipped out.

Hey Hyde Supporters,
Happy New Year! We hope everyone is having a great start to 2019.
Thank you again for everyone's patience. We understand this has been a long and stretched-out process. We have learned a lot in the past couple of months, and have already made changes so that this will not happen again in the future.

Hey Hyde Supporters,
Happy Holidays! We hope everyone had a fantastic Thanksgiving with their families and loved ones.
We know this has been a long process, and again we want to thank you for your patience. As you can imagine, the whole clothing industry gets backed up during the holidays season. The fabric has been successfully treated and was shipped today to Los Angeles. This means that once it arrives in LA, our manufacturer will begin the production process and will take about 6 weeks to create all of the shirts. Like we have said in the past, this is the first production run so we appreciate everyone's patience and understandings. We are almost there, and will keep updating you all in the next few weeks.

Hey Hyde Supporters,
Hope everyone is extremely excited to receive their shirts! Thank you for everyone who filled out the surveys. You should have received the survey email where you had the ability to choose the details for your rewards. If you didn't complete the survey, we do not have the correct information for what reward you wanted and will keep reaching out.
Speaking of shirts, we have great news! The fabric was shipped to the treatment facility in North Carolina. This is where the cotton will be finished with the hydrophobic solution. We will update you after that process is done, in which the fabric will then be sent to Los Angeles to get ready for production. We are doing our best to get the shirts out to you guys before Christmas, but due to the holiday season, there is backup in both the treatment facility and manufacturing company. We will make sure to keep updating you through this process and to be as transparent as possible. This is the first production run so we appreciate everyone's patience and understandings.

Hey Hyde Supporters,
Thank you again for your patience. You should have received the survey email where you have the ability to choose your rewards. If you donated to a tier that included a dress shirt, please click on "More Details" in the survey to see our sizing charts. This will ensure that you choose the correct fit. In addition, it is crucial that you ignore any shipping method other than free shipping. DO NOT pay for faster shipping as we still need to have the shirts produced and will not have the rewards to you in 2 days.

Hey Hyde Supporters,
Thank you for your patience during these past 2 weeks. We have been waiting on some last finishing details from our manufacturing company and we are now ready to finish the Backer Survey. If you donated to a pledge tier which included a dress shirt, please be on the look out for an email on Sunday, October 7th, as it will contain the survey to choose your size, color, and an area to include your shipping address. In addition, you'll have the opportunity to upgrade your package for extra dress shirts and DH gear you may have missed out on.

Hey Hyde Supporters,
Now that the dust has settled, we can finally start the process of getting these shirts manufactured. During this process, we will write bi-weekly updates to make sure you are all informed on the different stages of production. We want to be as transparent as possible to make sure nobody is thrown off with any surprises.
That being said, we are currently creating a survey for you guys to provide your color preference, along with sizes and where to ship your shirts. This will also give you an opportunity to buy any extra DH gear that you may have missed out on. Expect to receive this survey next week. Once we collect everyone's information, we can place the order for our fabric to be treated.

updates.update_userinfo: YOU DID IT! 107% FUNDED / 23 HOURS LEFT
updates.update_content:
Hey Hyde Supporters,
You did it! With 23 hours to go, we are currently 107% funded and have raised $37,455. That is amazing! It is hard to put how much we appreciate all of the love and support into words. We couldn't have done this by ourselves. There has been a lot of time put into this clothing revolution, and can't wait to finally get you this solution. So tonight, we raise a glass of whisky to congratulate everyone who has helped us get to this point. And tomorrow, we start the process of getting you the best dress shirts ever worn!

campaign.story:
Remember your first computer? Your first time using a GUI? Your first glimpse of that candy-colored desktop? Your first MP3 player? Your first smartphone? No matter what age you are, one of these things has impacted your life in some way. And to think, they all came from the same beloved company!  These devices let us realize our creative potential, connected us to each other to form meaningful relationships and of course... Changed. Our. World. At Throwboy we chose to pay tribute to these 5 iconic and important products that shaped our favorite technology company. Introducing... The Iconic Pillow Collection.
The Iconic Pillow Collection
What is the Iconic Pillow Collection? 
5 throw pillows inspired by 5 iconic, game-changing products of the technology world. Each pillow takes you through a different era in the computer revolution and celebrates the memories we made during these times. Made of super soft, high quality plush material, these 3D pillows feature fine embroidery, smooth contours and artisan style craftsmanship. This 5 pillow set celebrates the iconic hardware, mold-breaking design and historical significance of 5 beloved products. Help us bring this collection to life and own a piece of tech history in the form of these premium quality, designer plush throw pillows that are waiting to brighten up your home.
1977 Pillow
1984 Pillow
1998 Pillow
2001 Pillow
2007 Pillow
Why these 5 designs?
Though there have been many important products that have contributed to a shift in computing and culture, we felt that these 5 were the "home runs" in history. Each design was released under the most prolific co-founder/CEO of our time, and each played an integral role of shaping the company we know today. They pushed the computer and electronics industry forward into new and uncharted places.
Backer Rewards
Back this project and pick any of the 5 Iconic Pillows: 1977 Pillow, 1984 Pillow, 1998 Pillow, 2001 Pillow and 2007 Pillow. Choose from 1 to all 5! Each is available now at an unbeatable KS special.
High Quality Craftsmanship
When it comes to any Throwboy pillow, quality always comes first. With The Iconic Pillow Collection we feel that we've raised our premium quality to a new level. Each pillow is made of ultra-soft 100% vegan fine grain plush. All details are achieved using precision embroidery rather than low-grade printing techniques. These 5 designs have been revised to perfection to represent the 5 beloved products of where they took inspiration. Additionally each pillow features woven and silk screen labels, plus a sturdy hang tag with debossed letterpress text.

Details
3D design
Ultra soft plush material
Poly fiber filling
Satin stitch embroidery detail
Measures approximately 13in x 5in x 13in (33cm x 13cm x 33cm)
Weighs approximately 1lb 
Silk screen label on back
Woven label on side
Premium quality and craftsmanship
Limited edition

1977 Pillow
1984 Pillow
1998 Pillow
2001 Pillow
2007 Pillow
The Process
Through months of drawings and prototypes, from the sketch pad to the sewing table we meticulously designed each pillow to incorporate the spirit of 5 world-changing products. With the Iconic Pillow Collection we raised our quality standards to a new level to make something wonderful for your home.
Fabric swatches
Concept drawings
Motivation
Throwboy began 10 years ago with a vision of making a new kind of pillow that let people express the things they love. Beginning with our Icon Pillow Collection, a decade later that mission remains as we've grown to create pillows and products for all passions. For our 10 year anniversary we wanted to get back to our roots and celebrate the tech community that embraced us and made Throwboy possible. The Iconic Pillow Collection is without question our finest work to date and each can be enjoyed as a cuddly pal, a home decor conversation piece, a collector's item or all of the above.
Manufacturing
Since 2013, we have worked with the same trustworthy manufacturer that adheres to our high quality standards and delivers our products in the most timely manner. For the Iconic Pillow Collection we will continue to work with this factory to mass produce this special Kickstarter run of pillows.

Shipping and Delivery
All rewards will ship from our headquarters in Seattle, Washington USA by our team of trained employees and interns. We strive to bring you each reward at the lowest shipping rate available via the United States Postal Service with true rates for shipping and handling. International shipping is available to most countries. 


About Throwboy
The Throwboy brand is synonymous with unique, high quality throw pillows made for self expression. Started in 2007 as a one-man pillow factory in Seattle, Washington USA, we became the home decor staple among the internet savvy with our trendy product line and high quality craftsmanship. The idea for Throwboy formed after Roberto Hoyos hand-sewed 7 pillows shaped like computer icons as a gift for his girlfriend. When photos of the pillows went viral online causing Hoyos' website to crash, a business opportunity was born. With a built-in audience, Throwboy took off and went on to define a new kind of throw pillow.
We built upon the original idea and continued to introduce more pillows inspired by digital lifestyle including the original Emoji Pillows®. From there we expanded into multimedia with our Pillow Fighters brand that includes apps, comics, stuffed figures and more. We now collaborate with select top brands for special edition Throwboy pillows and Pillow Fighters, while infusing our signature style into each collection.
Today, Throwboy is available through our exclusive global distribution partners and through our own online store. The sewing and designing traditions Hoyos' learned from his grandmother remain the foundation of the company as shown in our inspiring and carefully crafted products.
Credits
Video by: Weak Spot - http://weakspot.productions/
Music by: Joakim Karud
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Here at Throwboy we're committed to making this project happen. We've identified the three major roadblocks that could keep us from our goal and developed a strategy to overcome these obstacles. They are:

- Reward fulfillment problems: We've already identified a team of Throwboy interns and volunteers to work with us in a dedicated space that will be used only to fulfill rewards in a timely manner.

- Trouble identifying a manufacturer: As stated above, we have been working with a trustworthy manufacture for 5 years that has been abiding by our high quality standards and allowed us to import/export thousands of pieces of inventory, including but not limited to our Emoji Pillows line. For the Iconic Pillow Collection we will continue to work with our manufacturer to deliver this premium product.

- An incomplete design: Throwboy pillows start with an idea that’s fleshed out into a full design. Multiple versions of a design are created until a final is chosen. For the Iconic Pillow Collection, Roberto Hoyos has finished a final design and created finalized pillow samples. In other words, the images of the pillows are not artist renderings. All that’s left is the funding to back this project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Backers! 
I made something new that I think you might love! They're called Pocket Pillows and they're available on Kickstarter now! CLICK HERE
Pocket Pillows are pint-sized, plush symbols of the things you love. Our most popular Iconic Pillows (1984 Pillow and 1998 Pillow) are now available as Pocket Pillows! Only $15 USD (KS Special price), they're perfect for your desk, for fidgeting, for collecting.

Hello Backers! 
I wanted to once again thank all of you for making The Iconic Pillow Collection possible. It took more than a year of hard work but now this new line of our best Throwboy pillows is real and available to the public. Thank you! 
IMPORTANT: If you have not received your Kickstarter Reward (aka your pillows) please let us know. Each of you received a Backer Survey via Kickstarter message which is used to provide your pillow selections and shipping information. If you did not check your messages (or did not get a notification about the message) and fill out your survey, we did not receive your pillow selection and shipping information. It is our top priority for you to receive your Kickstarter Reward, so be sure to let us know if you're still waiting!

Hello Backers! 
We've been busy getting all the Super Early Bird and Early Bird backer rewards shipped and we're just about done! We're getting ready to start on all the other Kickstarter backer shipments now!

Hello Backers! 
Today is the day! This morning a glorious container of Throwboy pillows was delivered to our warehouse (The Pillow Fort!) and we've begun shipping your backer rewards! Woohoo!

Hello Backers! I hope you're having an excellent 2019 so far!
We've been hard at work on the Iconic Pillow Collection and making all the preparations to ship them to you. We're now in the home stretch and still on track to begin shipping later this month starting with our Super Early Bird backers. The finished production batch of Throwboy pillows is en route from our factory to our warehouse now. Woohoo!
---

updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
We’ve been hard at work on the Iconic Pillow Collection and production is in full swing. Lots of sewing, fabric cutting and stuffing is happening now and we couldn’t be more excited to get these Throwboys into your hands!

campaign.story:
We create beautifully illustrated children’s books that are perfectly personalized for your family. Family stories can finally be fun for kids! We’ve created books that children will LOVE, including dynamic content and exquisite illustrations to capture the attention of our youngest readers! This will become a favorite in your storybook collection.
     1. Mad Lib - Provide fun facts about the family member of your choosing. 
2. Auto Magic - We’ll create your book based on the information you provide us with. 
3. Print & Ship - Your book will be bound and sent to you in an heirloom storybook for happy children!
No two books will ever be the same!
  Children need better bedtime stories! The characters in your children's books are remembered for a lifetime. These are fundamental moments in their development. Allow their hero and favorite storybook character to be a grandpa who started his own shoe shop, or a grandmother who raised six children solo. Your children will grow to appreciate their family story and develop what scholars call an "intergenerational self". Academic research shows that children who know the stories of their family have a stronger sense of identity and a better understanding of who they are in the world.
    Helping children learn their family stories can be really hard. We are making it fun and memorable for you, and your kids!
                  We’re on a mission to help others understand their story by knowing of their forebears! Our platform allows families to create unique children’s books about their family members. Help children discover where they’ve come from, by sharing their rich family legacy! We make it easy to commemorate the life of loved ones and cherish their stories forever.
                               Return Policy: Since we make custom books, we do not allow for returns on books we've already made. If we made a mistake in your book we will be happy to discuss creating a new book for you at no charge.
We are passionate about creating amazing products and Kickstarter is a way for us to launch our brand. As you've read Kickstarter isn't a store and rewards are a thanks for supporting the project. Your pledge means so much and we take it very seriously so that we can build a fantastic product.
Customs: We can not mark any rewards as a gift. It is illegal to do so. Import duties and taxes are not included in our reward levels. These charges vary by country and are completely out of our control. We are shipping our books all over the world and it is impossible for us to build the various customs charges into the reward level through Kickstarter.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We already have relationships with a printer, an illustrator, and a software tool and have delivered several books to customers. The biggest risk is how fast we can deliver batches after the holiday special as that largely depends on how many orders we receive.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Spring Delivery Backers!
We're excited about the changes and progress we've made on our product, thanks to early-customer feedback. We have been preparing for our spring delivery, and look forward to creating your books!
Last week we attended Rootstech - and sold hundreds of books. We are feeling excited and invigorated after the success coming out of Rootstech, and are eager to fulfill your orders.

Hello there!

I wanted to share another quick update for what we have in the works! We've been sorting and organizing all the orders, separating those of you who received books for Christmas and the rest of our customers who are part of our Spring Delivery! 

One challenge we saw in our previous batch was the photos page. You'll have the option to upload 4 of your favorite photos of the individual whom this book is created about. It's one of our favorite parts of the book as it really brings the story to life. In our first batch, because we're automating our platform, we didn't have anyone manually crop and adjust each photo. This meant that a lot of the pictures were cropped poorly because of the page design.

FourBears Backers!

Today the first batch of books was sent out! They will be arriving Friday and Saturday to our US customers. We wished to have sent them earlier but it felt like everything in the universe was against us these past few weeks in preparation. Our team pulled several all-nighters as well as our printers have been staying late to make sure these could get to you before Christmas. We are so relieved to tell you that they are being shipped today though and are very anxious for you to receive them! We can't wait to hear your feedback. 

As for the second group receiving their books: we are going to change the style of the survey and make some minor changes and improvements that we feel are necessary based on feedback we've received thus far. In the next few weeks you'll be hearing from us (via the email you've provided here on Kickstarter) and we will contact you to create your books. 

Lastly, we're excited to announce that our new landing page is live on ! We are continuing to take orders there. If you want to order more books, about different ancestors or if you know other people would be interested in this, but missed the opportunity on Kickstarter, make sure to view our new website!

As always, thank you for your patience and support. We are grateful for this growing FourBears Community, it means so much to us. 

Merry Christmas,
Juliette & The FourBears Team

updates.update_userinfo: First shipment sent! A Christmas Miracle!
updates.update_content:
We have just under 48 hours left on Kickstarter! This last week we have been prepping and organizing all of the books for our first shipment, and when we have sent those to the printer we will reach out to our second group to complete their information. 

If you wish to change your order, adjust your pledge, add extra copies of your books make sure to do that before our campaign is over! We are planning to launch our new website (where we will continue to take orders) in the next few weeks so check back at www.fourbearsbooks.com to see continued progress and updates on our product. 

If you know of anyone who would love this product, please share this Kickstarter with them so they can have access to our pre-production prices. Prices will never be this low again! We really appreciate your feedback and comments so let us know what you've thought of the project thus far! As always feel free to message me if you have any questions. 

Best wishes!
Juliette and the FourBears Team

Hello friends of FourBears!

We're now just over 3 weeks into our campaign and we've had such a journey so far! I've enjoyed getting to know many of your through the process of beginning the creation of your books. We were recently featured in two different local news articles, and I wanted to share those here with you to see what is being said about FourBears! 

"Customized children's books make family history fun, kid-friendly" - Deseret News or >>

- Silicon Slopes

We are absolutely loving the feedback we're getting and enjoy learning about the wonderful people starring in your family stories!

campaign.story:
Since we started Sidewalk Chalk in 2008, we’ve recorded three albums, played over 600 shows, shared stages with some of our musical heroes, and our family of 8 has grown to include thousands of you.  
Now we need your help to record our fourth album, An Orchid Is Born. We’ve come a long way, but we still have a long way to go. Each of us has made huge sacrifices to get this music to you, and now it’s time to grow together.
We’ll be traveling to Omaha at the end of this month to record with Grammy-award winning producer and drummer Robert “Sput” Searight (Snarky Puppy, Kendrick Lamar, Kirk Franklin). Why Omaha? Because we want to get out of the city for 7 full days of nothing but music.
After recording, producing, mixing, and mastering the album, we need to promote it. We’ll be working with our friends at Cosign, Kilzone, and Revive to help make An Orchid Is Born our biggest release yet.
For the physical album, we’re going to sell it as a wearable, listenable piece of jewelry. Just plug headphones into the orchid and press play. We're also going to print vinyl (finally!).
An Orchid Is Born is our most ambitious album yet, and we need all of your help to make it. We didn’t get this far by ourselves and we need you to keep going!
Here's how we'll be spending the money that you donate:
Step 1: Recording the album
$6,150 for studio time at Make Believe Studios (Omaha, NE) from June 27-July 3
$1,700 for travel to Omaha and lodging
Step 2: Finishing the album
$7,000 for production with "Sput"
$1,500 for mixing
$1,500 for mastering
Step 3: Digital Design
$500 for single artwork and new website images
Step 4: Music Videos
$1,000 each for 3 music videos
Step 5: Photography
$500 for new photos to promote the album
Step 6: Press and Radio Campaign
$1,750 with Revive Music
$1300 with Cosign Media (US Radio)
$600 with Kilzone (CA radio)
$825 printing and shipping radio mailers
Step 7: Merch
$2,000 for 75 men's shirts, 75 women's shirts and 50 hats ($9.50 ea. for shirts, $11.50 ea. for hats)
Step 8: The Physical Album
$2,725 for 1,000 wooden cases and printing
$1,500 for 1,000 mp3 players
TOTAL COST: $36,000 ($32,550 +10% credit card and Kickstarter fees)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Unlike our previous albums, we're not even going to think about a release date until after we have the album finished, mixed, and mastered. This will give us enough time to promote it the right way and have a specific release strategy, instead of losing our minds to cut corners trying to meet deadlines. This doesn't mean that you won't see the music until 2020, it just means that we are going to work tirelessly to get this thing right before we put it out. 

Pressing vinyl can be very expensive and most plants have extremely long wait times. Luckily, we will be working with Shuga Records in Chicago to cover the costs and make the process as smooth as it can be. Nevertheless, it is always possible that vinyl pressing gets pushed back, simply because of supply & demand. 

We have laid out the album's budget in a clear and, most importantly, realistic way. We've made albums for less money, and we know plenty of bands that have made great albums for next-to-nothing. In our case, this is what we need to make An Orchid Is Born the best and most impactful album we've ever made. We have three albums under our belt and by now, we know the expenses and pitfalls of the process. We're confident that $36,000 will get the job done.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Putting Our Money Where Our Mouth Is
updates.update_content:
If you've been listening to us for a while, you know that we're not afraid to use our music as a platform for social commentary (check out "Them, Us"). We're tackling some of those same themes and then some on An Orchid Is Born, and this week we put our money where our mouth is by depositing 100% of our Kickstarter funds into Illinois Savings Federal, one of the three black-owned banks in Chicago. If you'd like to join us in investing your money in your communities and divesting from big banks, check out THIS list!
Since we're talking about money, see below for an update on our spending so far after wrapping up most of the recording process two weeks ago in Omaha. The studio time cost less what we planned for, so we used some of the extra money to bring in Make Believe Studio's in-house film crew to document the process! We'll be using the footage to put together a live song video, as well as behind-the-scenes clips and interviews.
PLAY
PLAY

comments.content: Let us know if you end up doing any concerts while down in the Omaha area.

campaign.story:
[Update: See what SFist wrote about us!]
Everybody knows that friendship rules. But what goes into the secret sauce of friendship? Kristen, Cory and James here on the KNOW YOUR HUMANS! team think it's all about being able to express yourself authentically through conversation and play.
That’s why we simmered that secret sauce directly into KNOW YOUR HUMANS!, a new party card game for 3 - 10 players, ages 16+.
In just a few rounds, strangers become friends, and friends become even closer. Originally inspired by Truth-or-Dare, our game prompts players to interact in three awesome ways:
Question Cards that range from silly hypothetical to thoughtfully personal.
Action Cards with ridiculous cooperative challenges.
And Battle Cards that will have your friends facing off in competitive mini-games.
It's your new secret weapon against boring conversation and forgettable hangouts.
80% of the cards involve 2 or more players, so you’ll rarely play alone, and no one has to sit on the sidelines for long. You might learn about someone’s supervillain alter ego, invent a secret handshake, or have an epic finger fencing battle!
KNOW YOUR HUMANS! is perfect for:
Learning new things about humans you’ve known forever 
Breaking the ice with new humans 
Bringing different circles of friends together
…when you’re hanging out at home, festivals, family gatherings, bachelor/ette parties, on vacation, or any of the other weird places you humans gather.
But this ultimate weapon against boring hangouts won’t exist without YOU! So if you’re the kind of person who wants to know how your roommate would survive the zombie apocalypse, and participate in a massively multiplayer thumb war all in the same game, please help us make this dream a reality.
With love & pajama parties for all,
Kristen, Cory, & James
How To Play
To play the game, everyone begins with three random cards in their hand, and one player starts the game off as the “Party Wizard.” Everyone submits one card from their hand that they think the Party Wizard will want to play.
The Party Wizard chooses one of the submissions, and plays the prompt on the card, which might be a question, action, or battle. Whoever submitted the chosen card gets 1 point, unless it was a Battle Card. In that case, whoever wins the battle gets 2 points.
The Party Wizard then gets to return the cards she or he didn’t choose back into the deck anywhere they like. All players draw a new card from the deck, and the role of Party Wizard shifts to the left. The game ends when one lucky human reaches 3 points.
Our Story
Once upon a time, James, Cory, and I used to socialize by simply sitting on our butts and drinking, like normal humans… And then we experienced raves, art festivals, and travel adventures with friends. During those experiences, we discovered that the most memorable parts weren’t the DJs or the beautiful destinations. While we do love a good laser light show, the best moments were when we got to bond with our favorite people on a deeper level.
We began to understand that it’s possible to design experiences that maximize both fun and meaningful connection. This combination had a powerful impact on our own lives, and we wanted to find ways to share what we had learned with more people.
Our first idea was to host live events for this purpose. Our big test was a New Year’s party complete with a storytelling “tattoo” parlor, an indoor playground, and even a giant neon squid puppet partying with us on a black light dance floor. We really felt the magic of bringing people closer, but our impact was limited to people who could attend. We wanted that magic to reach many more friend groups beyond our city. So, we took everything we had learned about bonding through play, and baked it into a card game that anyone could experience anywhere.
Every day more adults are gathering to connect face-to-face over card and board games. As life long gamers ourselves, we are incredibly inspired to be a part of this global movement. And since we’re driven by connection, we wanted to make a game where no matter who wins, everyone walks away with new memories, inside jokes and appreciation for the humans you played with.
Through our experience creating live events, we had learned that there are some key elements in the secret sauce of connection. So, we built KNOW YOUR HUMANS! around two of the most important ones - personal storytelling and play. Now that we’ve got this game, even a night sitting around on our butts drinking can turn into a night we remember forever. We’ve spent the past nine months testing and revising the game, and now we need your help to take it prime time!
We Need Your Help!
Obviously, we need your hard earned cash to help us produce the game, but we’re also incredibly excited to see how all you superhero (and supervillain) geniuses out there in the Kickstarter community can help make KNOW YOUR HUMANS! even better. We will have opportunities for you to playtest our current prototype, and weigh in on things such as: 
Optimal number of points for a win 
Upper limit on group size 
Best 2 player remix 
Best non-competitive remix
And of course we’re open to your new card suggestions as well. Let’s make something new and awesome together, ya’ll!
Stretch Goals
Our current prototype cards come snuggled inside of a ridiculously cute cat or dog travel pouch. The pouch always gets a laugh, and puts people in the mood to play. It’s like a wingman that primes people for fun wherever you take it. Producing custom pouches at scale would be expensive, but if we sell 1,500 copies, everyone will get an awesome carrying case instead of a boring ol’ cardboard box! (Please note: Cards in the photo below are of an older version of the game. All backers will receive the new and improved deck which is bridge-sized and a new animal pouch design that is TBD!)
FAQ
How many players does the game support? The standard rules support 3-10 players, but the game can be remixed to play with different group sizes. We will be asking our community to experiment with different group sizes during our public playtesting phase.
What's the age range for the standard game? We think 16+ is a good suggestion, but there’s no hard language or sexually explicit material in the game.  Our age suggestion is more reflective of the mature nature of our Question Cards - for example, it might be tough for a 10 year old to answer “What’s an identity you’ve left behind?”  
What's the age range for the NSFW Booster pack?  The suggested age for the NSFW booster cards is 21+ because they will include drinking games, stronger language and some sexual questions.
How long does it take to learn and play? Learning only takes a few minutes, so it’s easy to bust out at a party. Play times vary depending on how many players are involved, but generally range from 15-40 minutes. It can also be played non-competitively for as short or as long as you like. Use it as a 10 minute ice breaker, or stay up playing until dawn - see if we care, we’re not your Dad!
What's included with the game? A 53 card deck of Question, Action, and Battle Cards, an instruction card, and a box made of space age material (cardboard). If we hit our stretch goal, we’ll replace the box with a custom carrying pouch!
Where are you printing the cards? Panda Games will be our partner for manufacturing.
Can I change/update/delete/add to/massage my address/order? Yes. At the end of the campaign, we'll send out a survey asking for a final mailing address plus a detailed description of exactly what you ordered so we can be sure to send you the right swag.
What size are the cards? Our cards are “bridge” size (2.25"x3.5"), which are slightly smaller than standard poker cards (2.5"x3.5"). The smaller cards travel nicely, and we want you to be able to KNOW YOUR HUMANS! anywhere you wander on Spaceship Earth!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’ve tested the game with friends (and strangers who then became friends) for nine months before launching this Kickstarter. So we know it’s fun, and we know it helps people get to know each other. One of our cards resulted in the invention of a new hug called “Booty Dreams” that’s been outlawed in 5 states, so I guess that’s a risk.

We’ve lined up Panda Games as our manufacturer, and ShipWise as our fulfillment partner, so we should be good to go there. Unforeseen issues can always arise, but with our team of 3 top notch problem solvers on board, we’re committed to handling anything that might get between you and your game!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Favorite Humans,
Apologies for the radio silence this past month, but we've been hard at work behind the scenes to prep for manufacturing!  We received our test print copies from our manufacturer yesterday, and they look great:

updates.update_userinfo: NSFW Expansion Pack Development Is Nearly Done...
updates.update_content: When we first decided to offer a Not Safe For Work (NSFW) Booster Pack as part of our Kickstarter, we had no idea that the NSFW reward would be nearly 3X as popular as the standard deck!  We originally thought we might offer about 20 new cards in the NSFW expansion, but we've been inspired by the demand, and are trying to develop as many fun new card ideas as we can before we hit our deadline to send everything off to print at the end of the month.  It's not always easy to come up with cards that fit our design standards, but I'm now confident that we'll have at least 30 new cards in the NSFW booster pack!  We've got twerk contests, marker tattoo challenges, and a slew of spicy questions to spark late night conversation coming your way, soon!

First, I want to just give a huge THANK YOU to everyone who has backed us so far - we're almost to our goal thanks to you!  We only need about 20 more backers, so if you have anyone in your life who you think would dig our game, please help us spread the word!
Secondly, we just posted a case study about how we used the Google Ventures' design sprint process in creating KNOW YOUR HUMANS!  If you're curious about how our team started out creating live events but then ended up making a card game, check it out!

updates.update_userinfo: Who Wants to Test KNOW YOUR HUMANS!?
updates.update_content:
We've got a couple of fun testing opportunities coming up:
If you live in Berkeley or Oakland, you can join us live next Wednesday, 7pm at Endgame (921 Washington St, Oakland, CA 94607).
We're also giving away advanced copies of KNOW YOUR HUMANS! for people who want to help test the game from home, but they're going fast - only 5 left!

Dear Day 1 Backers,
YOU ROCK!  Our funky lil party game is nearly 20% funded on day 1, and we have YOU to thank!  Because of your support, we're well on our way to bringing more joy, connection, and well, plain ol' stupid fun into the world.  
Extra big shout out to those who backed at the "Designer Pack" level - we're so excited to see the custom cards you'll create!

campaign.story:
The Kickstarter's over. Pre-order Range Dial from us.

Make the most of your time and ingredients.
Cooking can be a joy when you make a delicious meal, a disappointment when you get it wrong, and disaster when you present the charred, leathery wreckage to your hungry friends and family. 
That's why we created Range Dial — a precision cooking thermometer that works with or without your smartphone. Range helps you achieve that kitchen joy whether it's grilling, baking, brewing, or candymaking.
Range Dial is the evolution of our previously Kickstarted thermometer, Range. We've learned a lot from how our customers use Range, and added the top requests: Bluetooth for wireless monitoring, and a second probe for ambient temperature. But we also thought carefully about the friction points and how we could address them.
Range Dial works with or without a smartphone. Having a connected device shouldn't mean you have to mess with an app for the most basic functions. Just plug in the probe and turn the dial to a preset—Range Dial will beep at you, and you'll also get a push notification on your phone when your food is done. Or open the app to have full control. It's the best of both worlds.
We paid attention to the details. Range Dial is extremely precise thanks to our custom engineered temperature-measuring circuit and probes. It's built to last with machined stainless steel, silicone and polycarbonate. We didn't even take the temperature probe for granted, carving useful features into it.
A history
Hi, I'm John. For years I've been obsessed with integrating new interfaces and connectivity into everyday objects. At the MIT Media Lab, I built a series of objects that get past the idea that you have to pull out a screen and poke at it to perform basic tasks. That's not the future—that's a step backward.
I also love cooking for my family and experimenting in the kitchen, though I'm no expert. With our original Range cooking thermometer, I got better results and did less hovering over the stove and grill.
Thousands of you chefs using Range, professionals and enthusiasts, taught us what we could continue improving. You want a Bluetooth tool that does what it's told with minimal futzing. We listened.
Tinker with your recipes, not with an app. Range Dial can do things no other thermometer can, and yet we've designed it around a physical dial so you don't have to use your phone.
I'm excited to build a great cooking tool for all of us to use. So, let's tear our bloodshot eyes off our screens (after you're done reading this page and pledging) and savor the sights, smells and tastes of life!
What you can do with Range Dial
Cook a juicy turkey while prepping the sides (throw away that horribly inaccurate pop-up thermometer)
Smoke tender brisket overnight while watching your ambient temperature
Repeatable and recordable homebrew recipes
Learn about the sugar stages and how temperature stalls 
Make your own yogurt and cheese 
Correct for your inaccurate oven (have you checked? It's bad.)
Sous vide soft-cooked egg 
Experiment with variations and collect data on your recipes
What our backers and customers are already doing with the first Range:
Versatility, now and in the future
We've engineered probes for Range Dial to meet any job:
Range Dial has two probe ports. This makes it possible to watch two dishes at once, or get a second reading for ambient temperature (critical for smoking or precise oven roasting). And it means that your Range Dial will be versatile, taking advantage of new and improved cooking sensors. 
For the technically inclined, Range Dial will work with our existing SDK so you can add temperature to any app, and allow you to replace the firmware with an Arduino one so you can build your own sensors and control systems. We can't wait to share the ideas we have planned, and to hear your ideas, too.
Support for iOS and plans for Android
Currently, Range Dial will work with your iPhone or iPad running iOS 8 or newer. Your device needs to support Bluetooth Low Energy to connect directly (which means iPhone 4S, iPad 3 or newer), but you can monitor remotely with older devices.
We want to support Android as well, and will be able to start working on an app that's up to our standards if we raise over $180,000. Even if we don't, an Android app will be made eventually. A pledge for Range Dial is your vote for Android support—you can always cancel your pledge before the end of the campaign if we don't reach that goal.
What makes Range Dial better?
More precise temperature measurement. It's easy (for an engineer) to measure temperature. But it takes time and passion to design a circuit that measures temperature really, really accurately, and most thermometers don't try that hard. We did because if you're going to get repeatable results, you need to have precise measurements.
Works without a smartphone. Turn Range Dial to one of the four presets. It'll beep when your food is done. (And yes, you can change what those presets are through the app.)
Better Bluetooth range. Bluetooth devices often have a disappointing connection in the real world. This is usually because they use a cheap trace antenna and turn the Bluetooth radio power down to save battery life. We do neither: Range Dial uses a ceramic chip antenna and crams in two AAA batteries, so we can get great range out of Bluetooth, and still have superior battery life.
Infinite range. When we say you can disconnect, we mean it. As long as you have one device connected to Range Dial via Bluetooth, you can monitor your temperatures from any device connected to the Internet.
Expandability. Each Range Dial has two ports to plug in sensors. This lets you monitor ambient temperature (critical for smoking or precise roasting and baking) or just a second dish. And it means that your Range Dial will be versatile, taking advantage of new and improved cooking sensors we develop in the future.
Top-notch materials and components. We're building a tool to last, so we made it out of stainless steel, polycarbonate and silicone.
Third-party apps. The Range app was designed to be straightforward for a range of needs, but you may want software tuned for your particular culinary specialty. Range is supported by Roastmaster for coffee roasting, iBrewMaster for homebrewing beer, and has a free SDK that any app can use to add support for temperature.
App
For iPhone and iPad running iOS 8 or newer
Read temperatures on a device connected by Bluetooth Low Energy
Read temperatures remotely on other devices via the Internet (no one else does this)
Set alerts for rising, falling, or temperature ranges with a swipe
F and C, USDA and gourmet presets
Done-time prediction 
Graphing with CSV data export
Change dial presets to whatever suits you
Specifications
Reads temperatures from -40ºF to 450ºF (-40ºC to 230ºC)
Accurate to 0.9°F at 150ºF (0.5ºC at 65ºC)
Bluetooth Low Energy (requires iPhone 4S, iPad 3, or newer)
2xAAA, 6 months battery life
Stainless steel, silicone, polycarbonate
Two multipurpose sensor ports
Rewards
Note that we may tweak finishes and colors a bit heading into production, but all with the aim of making this thing great.
Why we need your help
We've spent our own time and money so far on industrial design, engineering, sourcing components and lining up suppliers. To go into production, we need to polish off development, pay for tooling, and get a minimum quantity commitment. Quality doesn't come cheap.
We used our experience and deliberate engineering to get the cost down. We owe a lot to our community on Kickstarter for backing us before, and so you get a great price before Range Dial gets released to the rest of the world.
Kickstarter is also amazing for the conversations we can have with backers. When you back us, you won't just enable us to make Range Dial—as our first and most enthusiastic customers, you'll have the opportunity to shape it as we make some final decisions.
If you're an existing Range owner, this Kickstarter benefits you, too. It'll allow us to continue bringing new features to the Range app.
Schedule
We've done a lot of work so far, and we've padded the schedule for the inevitable mistakes that come when you're trying to work with factories to produce a complex product at scale. If delays do occur, we'll be upfront about what's going on.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
You're a Kickstarter backer — you know that making physical products is hard, and seen the horror stories. Every hardware product has a supply chain, and different companies may provide components, make custom parts, and assemble electronics. Each link in the chain can be a failure point — a part has to be redone because it's not up to our specifications, a shipment gets delayed, etc.

We've got a lot of experience doing this. Getting funded doesn't make a Kickstarter successful—shipping does, and we've shipped tens of thousands of complex products over two Kickstarters. We've already vetted and picked suppliers, many of whom we've worked with before. We can't plan for everything, but we are prepared.

Come with us on our mission to make better tools for cooks. Are you ready? We're ready!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Android support for Range Dial
Finally. It’s currently in beta—if you know how to sideload apps onto your device, you can download it. Once we have enough testing and fixing done, we’ll publish it for general consumption, so please contact customer support directly with any bug reports or questions you have.

Shipping
We’re about two thirds of the way through fulfilling all backer rewards. All US shipments should be done in the next two weeks, with the exception of those who haven’t filled out the Kickstarter survey (since that’s how we get your shipping address). If that’s you, log into Kickstarter and go to our campaign page — you should see a Manage Pledge button. If you have any questions, please send me a message directly — comments posted on the campaign page or an update sometimes get missed.
International shipping

Hello, backers — apologies for not updating you sooner. I enjoy wearing a bunch of hats in my work, but switching between them isn’t as easy for me. Coding and bug-fixing, especially, requires tuning out everything else. (More on that below.)

Save

We’re nearly on track with the late January shipping date I stated in the last update. I was planning the next update for when we started shipping, but since we’ve gotten requests for a status update (understandably), here’s what’s going on.
Shipping
We’ll freeze the address list next week, so if you’ve moved recently, update your address now by clicking “Manage your pledge” at the top of our product page. If you’re one of the 34 backers who haven’t yet answered the survey, please log into your Kickstarter account and you should see a banner with a link to your unanswered survey where you can give us your mailing address.

Save

When people ask me what I do, Kickstarter inevitably comes up, as it’s an integral part of our business. I like to tell them how launching products through Kickstarter is different, and there’s a reason. When you back a project here, you’re jumping in at a earlier phase of the product development cycle, and you get to see all the sweat and tears that go into any product.
You’ve certainly seen that here. A backer told me, “This stuff is hard for us waiting, but clearly harder for those living and breathing schedules, vendors, shipping and everything else we consumers miss.” I didn't set out to provide you with drama, but hopefully the updates at least give you an interesting view through my eyes.

updates.update_userinfo: The product that makes the product
updates.update_content: The first Range Dials are scheduled to begin shipping at the end of this month. Here’s what we’ve been doing.

Hey, backers — a quick update as we hurtle toward production (which is staying on the rails at the moment). Scroll to the end for some goodies from our friends.
World's thinnest survey
A benefit of backing us on Kickstarter is that you get to influence the product. Along those lines, you'll be getting the email from Kickstarter soon asking you to fill out the survey with your shipping address, and one other question: What preset temperature alert would you add to Range Dial?
Asked Questions 
Save

Retooled

I hope you all had a good, long Memorial Day weekend. Or if you’re not in the US, a regular good, long weekend.
We hit a big milestone since last update, and we’ve got some things to show you. And a few more to-dos for ourselves.
First parts off production tooling

campaign.story:
Thanks for watching our video! Want the nitty gritty details? Here you go:
 LIFE, AFTER is a web series by Corinne Caputo and Erica Tachoir.
The show follows two best friends (Corinne and Erica) who are hit by a bus, die, and become ghosts. Together, they navigate the strange rules of the afterlife while trying to figure out their unfinished business so that they can "pass on."
Corinne and Erica learn the hard way that ghosts can pass through walls but not glass. They accidentally haunt an old friend. A new "roommate" moves into their once beloved apartment. They try bringing Erica's former crush to a pottery wheel to reenact the scene from the movie Ghost. They meet other ghosts and find even more uncertainty about what the afterlife means. Perhaps there is no such thing as unfinished business at all...
Though it has dark moments (It is a show about death...), Life, After is ultimately a fun and light-hearted exploration of friendship. How does Erica and Corinne's friendship survive when time is infinite and responsibilities are absent? How do they navigate the uncertainty? How can they find a way to change their outfits?
Once we are funded, we plan to shoot Life, After this summer, targeting an online release for the fall.
The first season of Life, After will be ten episodes, all around three minutes. We want to keep the show short, engaging, and easy for online viewing. They will be released all at once (~Netflix style~), with the pilot episode coming out a week in advance, to allow people to view it at their own pace.
We intend to do everything we can to publicize the series and seek a larger platform for future seasons.
$21,600. It is lot of money. We get that. We also realize it might be hard to imagine where that money is going. Here's a rough overview of the budget to give you a sense of how the money will be spent:
Equipment and Transportation // $5,650 // Camera rentals, lighting, grip and electric... it takes a lot of gear to make videos! We're getting some great deals by using personal gear and equipment at reduced rental costs, but there's still a lot that we need to achieve the awesome production quality we want. Also, we need to be able to move all that stuff, from Point A to Point B, which means renting vans and paying for secure parking.
People // $4,575 // The key creative folks listed above have all graciously agreed to donate their time to this project. But we still need to pay the rest of our crew members because they are talented professionals (all of whom will be working below their normal rates). Also, regardless of pay, they all need to eat during long production days! We've included our food budget in this number as well.
Locations and Production Design // $3,275 // Ghosts party in a haunted hotel. Erica stages a seduction in a pottery studio. Corinne and Erica get hit by a bus. These scenes are going to require some specific location needs, and we need money to gain access to those awesome spaces. We also need to make our locations and the people in them look awesome and true to our ghost world.
Post Production // $5,000 // So often forgotten and neglected, post-production is really where the project comes together, and there's a lot that has to happen after the shooting wraps. Beyond the main picture edit, there's the sound design, the visual effects to create our ghostly appearances, music, and more!
Insurance // $1,500 // What if something breaks? What if someone gets hurt? Hopefully, our shoot will go smoothly without any major issues, but all sorts of things can happen on a set, and it's important for us to be covered and prepared for those situations.
Other // $1,600 // This covers everything from the fee Kickstarter takes to actually delivering on our rewards, as well as any other unplanned expenses.
You may be wondering why we decided to make Life, After as a web series. We firmly believe that the media landscape is shifting in favor of streaming platforms. We love high quality episodic content, and so many of our favorite shows are now viewed online. A successful web series has the potential to reach a much larger audience than we previously would have found at film festivals and more traditional platforms for independent creators. We want to be a part of this exciting new stage in entertainment.
We believe in the quality of the content we are creating with Life, After, and we think the time is ripe for this funny, earnest, female-driven comedy, and we believe it can find its best audience online.
CORINNE CAPUTO // co-creator and lead actor // Corinne is the author of How to Success: A Writer's Guide to Fame and Fortune, which will be published by Chronicle Books in Spring 2016. She has written for Refinery29, HelloGiggles, Bustle, and other sites. She studied improv and sketch comedy at the Upright Citizens Brigade and performs regularly in the monthly HelloGiggles show at the UCB Theater. Every year when blowing out her birthday candles, Corinne wishes to never see a ghost. www.corinnecaputo.com
ERICA TACHOIR // co-creator and lead actor // Erica is a graduate of the film department at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. Her short film, "Too Sunny for Santa," screened at festivals around the country and won some awards, too. She also studied at Atlantic Theater Company's acting school and at the Upright Citizens Brigade, where she and Corinne met. She has appeared in national commercials and in projects that have screened at film festivals and on the world's biggest stage: the internet. Erica swears she saw a ghost at night as a child, and she gasped so hard that she woke her parents. www.ericatachoir.com
PAUL PENCZNER // director // A graduate of NYU’s film program, Paul is a director at the Brooklyn based production company, Buffalo Picture House (www.buffalopicturehouse.com). He’s worked in the editorial department for features, short films and documentaries. As a director he has worked on commercials, short films, sketch videos, and educational projects. He also happens to be dating Erica. As a seven year old, Paul would not go into his family’s basement because he thought the ghost of Adolf Hitler lived there (He lived in Memphis).
TESSA TREANOR // producer // Tessa, a graduate of NYU/Tisch Film, has produced web content and short branded videos for clients such as 360i, A+E Digital Studios and Funny or Die as well as award-winning short and feature length films. She also produces for the popular comedy web series SRSLY (2014 Webby Awards Honoree). Tessa has never seen is a ghost, which is surprising since she is from England where everything is very old. www.tessatreanor.com
MATTHEW TROY // cinematographer // Matthew has worked as a cinematographer for a variety of film, TV, and web productions from as far away as New Jersey, where he shot the feature film Chasing Yesterday, to the even farther away destination of the Czech Republic. An alum of NYU's Tisch School of the Arts, where he received faculty commendations for his work behind the camera (and where he and Erica started collaborating in their freshman year), Matthew combines his volunteer firefighter/EMT and filmmaking skills to teach safety to current NYU students. As of this writing Matthew has never seen a ghost, but he has seen Ghost.
OUR CAST will be composed of talented comedic actors who have appeared on the UCB stage, Broad City, and High Maintenance, and in videos for IFC, Above Average and College Humor.
Thank you for taking the time to check out our project. We really hope you'll join our team and support Life, After, either by donating or sharing with your friends (or both!). We absolutely cannot make this without incredible people like you. 
If you have any other questions, please feel free to reach out to us at lifeafterseries@gmail.com. You can also join our mailing list at lifeafterseries.com and follow along on Facebook and Twitter.
If you are interested in Corinne and Erica's past work, you can watch their short film below or watch their web series, DIY Friends, here.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always uncertainties in video production. Locations can fall out, schedules can get pushed back, and we may need to rewrite episodes and scenes to better match our resources. We are 100% dedicated to getting this project made, while also remaining flexible to the variables that may be thrown our way. We plan to be transparent during this process and will update our backers with any variations from our original plan.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
The time has finally come!!! You can watch binge watch all eight episodes of Life, After at: lifeafterseries.com/watch 
We seriously could not have done this without your support. THANK YOU for backing us a year ago when this was just an idea. (Okay, there were scripts, and a team, but still...) You believed in us, and we really hope we delivered something that you can enjoy.
You've done so much to get us to this point. If you're willing, there's one more little thing you can do for us: watch the show and share it with your friends. :-) Help us spread the word and get some eyes on this thing!
We are so excited to be able to say the Life, After teaser trailer is here! Give it a watch below and keep an eye out for the entire series coming August 1st to lifeafterseries.com

After much anticipation we are so excited to announce that Life, After will be available to watch online next Monday, August 1st on lifeafterseries.com. We can't wait to share it with you! None of this would have been possible without your help. Thank you thank you thank you!
In the meantime you may enjoy the first in a series of countdown images and keep an eye out for our teaser trailer which will drop later this week!

updates.update_userinfo: SAVE THE DATE: PRE-RELEASE SCREENING PARTY

updates.update_content:
WOOHOO!!!
What does that mean? It means the actual editing of Life, After is complete. We’re happy with it, and we have no more changes to make. This is huge and very exciting for us.
So we’re done and ready to release now, right? Hold your My Little Ponies. There’s still more work to be done. This week, our director and editor Paul is having VFX and sound design spotting sessions, where he goes through the cuts with the appropriate team members to identify all the visual effects and sounds that need to be added. Then, those folks go off and make it all happen with elves in their magical visual effect and sound design castles!

Have you been wondering what's going on with Life, After? Well, we are deep in post-production. We've been reviewing the episode rough cuts, finessing them to make them as awesome as possible. We'll be doing a few feedback screenings with crew and friends soon to collect notes and reactions. Once the cuts are locked, it'll be on to VFX and sound! Stay tuned for more updates as we move closer and closer to our finished project. Yay!!!

While we’ve been hard at work on post-production for Life, After, we’ve also got something new coming down the pipeline. We wanted our amazing supporters to know about it and to see if you’d be willing to show us some more love.
We submitted a pitch called Colony to Project Greenlight’s brand new digital series contest, and we just found out that we're one of the twenty projects that have advanced to the second round! This means that we’re now part of a public vote, which will determine one of the five finalists. So if you don’t mind, take a moment to go and vote for us! You can only vote once and only for one project. Voting ends on December 18th.

In the (slightly belated) spirit of Thanksgiving, we wanted to take a moment to say how thankful we are for all of your support in helping us make Life, After. We figured you might like to hear an update on the project!
As you probably know, we wrapped production in September. Those were seven of the most intense days we’ve ever experienced. We had everything from a party scene with extras, to closing down a street to shoot our deaths, to those tricky visual effect shots (you know, walking through walls, no big deal). We have so much gratitude for the amazing cast and crew that was on board. We really could not have asked for a better team.

updates.update_userinfo: Less than a week from production!
updates.update_content:
This is getting very real.
On Wednesday, September 9th, production begins on "Life, After." We are super excited. And nervous. And overwhelmed. And stressed. But mainly excited.
We'll be shooting for six days in and around Brooklyn. It's going to be a very busy six days, with TEN episodes to get through, and a lot of different locations, fancy VFX shots, and even a ghost party. We have an AWESOME cast and crew that we'll share with you soon. Corinne and Erica are even small business owners now with an LLC and business bank account to prove it!

Wow. Nine whole days since the campaign ended. We've finally woken up from our nap and are ready to get to work. Just kidding, we've already been working! Script revisions, meetings, all kinds of good stuff.
Here's an update video:

campaign.story:
OUR SECRET POPLOCK (Magnetized) 
Our secret PopLock (patent pending) is the most convenient and secure way to leave your helmet behind. Just pop the top, and lock. And best of all—we're backing it with our Bike Thief Guarantee. If your helmet gets stolen while locked to your bike, we'll replace it. See our FAQs for terms and conditions.
OTHER KEY FEATURES
Vegan Leather Straps Reinforced with nylon webbing 
7 Air Vents + Internal Cooling Channels & Liner + Brim We did the research. Get great ventilation without the sci-fi design
Magnetic Buckle Say goodbye to pinched fingers
Vintage Moto Meets Modern Minimalist
Premium Matte Rubberized Finishes 
Available in 3 rich colors + a KickStarter-only "Stay Gold" edition (hand painted)
Helmets are an age-old industry with limited experts and planet-friendly options—and we want to change that. We've used environmentally-friendly alternatives, tracked the origin of our materials and found manufacturers with integrity.
Why Thousand?
We didn’t wear helmets, but after the loss of a friend, we wondered why. Especially after researching the statistics. In the US, there are roughly 1,000 bicycle-related fatalities in a year. That’s why we created Thousand to design helmets that we’d actually want to wear and therefore help save lives.
Design Inspiration
We were inspired by everything from vintage motorcycle helmets to Jack Kerouac's travels. From 7 a.m. commutes, to Sunday rides by the beach.
PRODUCTION PLAN
At the end of this project, we will send you a survey so you can select your helmet size. Check out the drawing below to get an early start!
Thousand is a group of social entrepreneurs, design junkies, and storytellers. We're obsessed with everything from value chains to color ways.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
PRODUCTION TIMELINE
We have established a relationship with one of the top helmet manufacturers in the business and will have boots on the ground to oversee every major production milestone. Thus, while we don't foresee any major production issues, we recognize that unexpected hiccups can happen. We promise to be transparent and to keep our backers updated on any potential delays.

IMPACT TESTING
We've designed our helmet to exceed all US (CPSC) and European (EN1078) Safety Standards. Though we're unable to complete our certifications until after production (by law), we are confident that is our design will exceed all testing requirements.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Would you mind getting into a bit more detail regarding VAT? I live in Spain, and having to pay VAT for individual parcels is pretty unfriendly. VAT is charged for both the product and shipping costs, and you also have to pay a fee to a private company in charge of handling international parcels. They often demand the payment be made in advance before releasing the parcel from central customs offices in Madrid, and lengthy delays are frequent. I know Thousand is not to blame for my country's bloated bureaucracy, but having the VAT handled on a EU level would be a big bonus to backers such as myself.
